channel.title: How do you track down family.... [Serious]
channel.description:
Well. My last name, let alone my first name, is very popular. I never met my dad. I only know his first name is Mike (I can get the last name from my mom). But I want to know, how do you track family down. I'm 17, so I don't think any 'database' will have my in it. But yeah, my name is Jesse Watson (some know it via skype.) And my dad's last name starts with an S. So that doesn't really. Yeah.
What do I do here.

item.title: How do you track down family.... [Serious]
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

Replying anyway…it’s hard to explain but ancestry.com will have literally every single little resource you can imagine.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you track down family.... [Serious]

item.title: How do you track down family.... [Serious]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Cruel Truth, post:20, topic:511549”][quote author=Jayden. link=topic=629794.msg4285987#msg4285987 date=1366339978]
Ancestry.com
[/quote]^ this, of course there is a trial/membership but well worth it. I actually bought this for my mother for mothers day for a year.[/quote]
It’d be really helpful, if you know… I had more information on him.
Names can change, and for all I know it’s not even his real name.

  • Don’t reply. I’m done looking. There’s no point in wasting my time finding this loser as is.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

marcbob:

Does your mom literally only know his name, or is she just not telling you more? I feel like she would lead you to him if she wanted to

That’s all she’s told me. I’ve asked her for more, but she said she had nothing else…

item.title: How do you track down family.... [Serious]
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:11, topic:511549”][quote author=jal knight link=topic=629794.msg4271866#msg4271866 date=1364592049]
It’s going to take a long time, and a lot of patience. It would be smart to head to his home town like someone else mentioned. Ask for pictures previous addresses etc. You will eventually have multiple pictures that you’ll have to choose which one looks more like you etc. You’ll find him if ya just look :3 gl
[/quote]Can you seriously not loveing read? He said MANY times that the ONLY information he can get is his dad’s first and last name - nothing else.[/quote]
Are you seriously that loveing ignorant? How hard would it be to pay $2 to find out where he could possibly be on site which gives reports? You know that would include his birth state and town. Quit being a penisy love.

penisy love… lol

Read full topic

had your mother and father been previously married you may be able to pull a SSN from the records. unfortunantly without any other information its like trying to find a needle in a stack of needles.

item.title: How do you track down family.... [Serious]
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Kill yourself.

You are just a box of daisies aren’t you?

OT: Social networks are probably your best bet now-a-days. Try places like pipl.com where you can find public records, can probably give you a general idea about where who you’re looking for is located.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you track down family.... [Serious]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:5, topic:511549”]Are you a boy or girl?

OT: Ask your mom if she can give you any other details, then try to find him on Social network places (MSN, Facebook, Twitter etc).[/quote]
The most I could get is hist first and last name.

Flame_:

If you have the time/money, go down to your dad’s childhood town. Library records, church records, and possibly local banks might have his name/whereabouts in store.

As stated before.
I literally can get only his first and last name.
Absolutely nothing else.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you track down family.... [Serious]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

TabbyKiller:

Look for old wedding photos or something like that. Other than that, Facebook, Google, Peoplefinder, it’s all going to be your best friend.

The only information of my biological dad is his name, that’s all.
No pictures, etc.
